alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:55AM PST until January 15 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches with locally higher amounts of 10 to 14 inches above 5000 feet north of highway 140. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades from near Lake of the Woods northward. This includes higher portions of Highway 140. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel could be very difficult with low visibilities at times, especially as snowfall rates peak Saturday night into early Sunday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.comfor latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
